intro: Parapentas gabonica, commonly known as the Gabon pentas, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. The Gabon pentas is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
